book.title: Keystone, the OpenStack Identity Service
book.para: Keystone is an OpenStack service that provides API client authentication, service discovery, and distributed multi-tenant authorization by implementing OpenStack’s Identity API.

This documentation is useful for contributors looking to get involved in our community, developers writing applications on top of OpenStack, and operators administering their own OpenStack deployments.
This documentation is generated by the Sphinx toolkit and lives in the source tree. Also see the page for other ways to interact with the community.

chapter.title: Related Projects
chapter.para: In addition to creating OpenStack’s Identity Service, the Keystone team also provides a WSGI middleware, an Authentication library and a Python client library.

chapter.title: General Information
chapter.para: This section sontains the general information related to keystone which is commom to all the developers, users and operators. For documentation specific to the any of these three, please see the subsequent sections.

chapter.title: Operator Documentation
chapter.para: This section contains the documentation for deploying and operating the keystone service.

chapter.title: User Documentation
chapter.para: This section contains the documentation for end-users of keystone.

chapter.title: CLI Documentation
chapter.para: This section details information related to keystone-manage.
